messages.content: How is G'MIC a part of ComfyUI?
G'MIC in ComfyUI is a custom node that provides image-processing features, including effects, filtering, geometric manipulation, image data, and color.
What makes G'MIC friendly for users?
G'MIC in ComfyUI is designed to be user-friendly for both beginners and power users with its ongoing documented workflows.
What is the command to install the G'MIC custom node?

You can install the G'MIC custom node by cloning the repository with the command `git clone https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC` or by copying the `comfy_gmic.py` file to your custom nodes folder.
What is required to use the G'MIC custom node?

To use the G'MIC custom node, you need to download the G'MIC Command-line interface (CLI) and G'MIC-Qt stand-alone interface, put the executable path in your PATH, and drag the provided workflow to ComfyUI.
When was the first upload of the G'MIC custom node for ComfyUI?
The first upload of the G'MIC custom node for ComfyUI was in November.
What platforms does the G'MIC custom node support?
The G'MIC custom node supports better cross-platform functionality as of February.
Is there a breaking change to be aware of in March?
Yes, in March there were breaking changes, and it is recommended to recreate your workflow.
What is the version of G'MIC-Qt and CLI used in the testing?
The version of G'MIC-Qt and CLI used in the testing is 3.3.4.
What version of ComfyUI is G'MIC custom node tested on?
The G'MIC custom node is tested on ComfyUI version [March 09](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/tree/a9ee9589b72aa0e2931f1c0705524c56adaee26d).
Where can I find more ComfyUI custom nodes for image processing?
You can find more ComfyUI custom nodes for image processing by visiting the [link](https://github.com/gemell1/ComfyUI_GMIC/wiki).
